item.title: Report E-2025020321
item.description:
Report E-2025020321

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-30
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 08:40 ET XPO notified ERTS of a spill at terminal NWN. Approx 2 cups of formosoda-p released from one 50-pound paper bag impacting the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller recommending a contract response, but the caller who is the acting SCM said they would be able to clean it up with PPE on-site. Waste put in one 65-Gallon Poly Drum.

item.title: Report E-2025020322
item.description:
Report E-2025020322

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2031 XPO Logistics of a 1oz release of UN1830 on the trailer. The cause was due to a nail puncture. Prior to calling ERTS the terminal clean the spill with oil dri and placed it into a 55gal poly drum. The terminal was reminded to call in all spills before cleaning. As per the BOL, Chemtrec was notified Greg issued report 2024120400227. 222918-1 was created.
